intro: Garnotia australindica, commonly known as the Western Australian daisy, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Garnotia australindica is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and woodlands.
